I really enjoyed taking this class. Yes, the projects are VERY time consuming and you must make sure you follow the directions entirely. The tests are pretty simple if you study the power points and read the chapters. As long as you follow directions and stay on top of your work you should be fine!!

Average professor. The projects are insanely time consuming, just make sure you DO NOt procrastinate. Super easy class if you pay attention and skim through the book. Also follow directions carefully! Altogether it was an easy A!

Class is interesting and he's pretty cool.  The assignments are ridiculous and SOOOO time consuming.  The journal is a task in itself so start early.  Read directions on assignments more than once because he WILL take off points and the points add up quickly.

Great guy, knows his stuff, makes class interesting. Follow guidelines EXACTLY or you'll lose points. Do the journal ahead of time, or you'll be panicking night before it's due. Read test q's VERY carefully, can be a bit tricky if you didn't pay attention, read, or review (I suggest doing all 3 before taking the test). Overall, I'd recommend him.

Crotts' class is enlightening. He keeps it interesting and is a fair grader. You get what you put in. The tests can get irritating so make sure you read  the textbook & take notes during the lectures. Aside from that, I highly recommend taking him. Projects are fun and competitive. I wish all the professors at KSU were more like him.
This class can be fun if you pay attention. Easy A if you follow directions and read the book.

Crotts really knows his stuff-- at the time of my class, he was an editor at the AJC and nearly always showed up in a great mood, ready to teach. If you follow instructions down to the T you WILL get a perfect grade on all the projects. Word of advice from this former student, though: study your you-know-what off for the exams; they're difficult!

Very good. He's fair and expects you to be prepared for class. You must read the book and pay attention in class (what a concept in college). tests are hard, projects are easy. He says the grade you get you earn. He lives by that guideline.

Wonderful teacher. He knows the material and is eager to share w/ you. You must pay attention in class and read the material to do well. He is fair, and the grade you get you must earn. He will not hand out grades. If you study, you will do well.

Mr. Crotts is very cool, and uses a lot of you tube videos to explain concepts.  His quizzes he admits he purposely tricks you, and assignments are very, very detailed.  You will lose a letter grade in your assignments for not highlighting something for example.  Good class though, watch out for the extreme details when doing assignments

One of my favorite professors at Kennesaw. I took this class because it was a part of my major and am now looking for more classes that he teaches. Attendence is mandatory but its worth it. 3 easy projects and 5 quizzes. TAKE HIM! Hes great!

Great professor, was fun and interesting. Repeated himself a lot though an was a really tough grader on assignments. Assignments are lengthy and intricate (as a college course should be). By all means, if you want a fluff class dont take this. If  you want to learn something and have fun: Professor Crotts is your guy
Extremely difficult grader on assignments, loves making exam questions tricky . . . you either love him or hate him but the class is fun!

He is really nice and loves his students. His quizzes can be a little difficult, but as long as you read the powerpoints & book and PAY ATTENTION in class you'll do fine. Also, if you do well on the projects you will bring your grade up easily. He is awesome! & FUNNY
